Wrapping StarTeam around VSS Projects

StarTeam projects can be wrapped around VSS projects by creating a project in StarTeam that uses a VSS project as its root folder. To accomplish this, the application reads the VSS folder hierarchy and the entire revision history and lock status for each file in the hierarchy. In addition, the application calculates the size of each revision. The same user name and password should be used in StarTeam Server and VSS.

To wrap a StarTeam project around a VSS project, so that they are interoperable:

  1. Do one of the following:

    • Click the New Project button on the toolbar.

    • Select Project > New from the menu bar.

    • Drag the srcsafe.ini file from Network Neighborhood or Explorer to an empty portion of the window to create the project.

    The New Project Wizard opens.

  2. From the server list, do one of the following:

    • Select the server configuration that will store the project. If you are not currently logged onto this server, the Log On dialog will request a log-on name and password. Enter this information, and click Next.

    • If the desired server configuration does not appear on the list, click Add Server to add access to it. See Adding a Server Configuration. Then select the new configuration.

  3. Click Next. The New Project Wizard: Project Name dialog opens.

  4. Enter the name of the new project in the Project Name text box.

  5. Enter a description of the project in the Project Description text box.

  6. Click Foreign Archives. The Select Foreign Archive dialog opens.

  7. Select the Create project from check box.

  8. Select the Visual SourceSafe option button.

  9. In the Database File Path text box, enter or browse for the database file path (by default, srcsafe.ini).

  10. In the Password text box, type the VSS password for the user currently logged onto StarTeam. This password should be the same as the StarTeam password.

  11. Click OK.

  12. Click Next from the New Project Wizard: Project Name dialog. The New Project Wizard: VSS Project dialog displays the VSS project hierarchy within the VSS database.

  13. Select the VSS project or subproject that will be the root folder for the new project, then click Next. The New Project Wizard: Working Folder dialog opens.

  14. In the Default Working Folder text box, enter or browse for the path to the root folder’s working folder. StarTeam wraps itself around the specified VSS project and its subprojects, recursively creating working folders for each VSS project beneath the project selected as the root. To create the working paths for each of these folders, the application starts with the path to the root folder’s working folder and appends folders for each level in the hierarchy, using the names of the subprojects. With VSS, StarTeam does not support user-specified working folder paths, except at the view level. As a result, some or all VSS working folders may be obsolete. If any problems are found, an error message asks you to check the vss-err.locale.log file. If the problems in the vss-err.locale.log file are severe, you can delete the StarTeam project and re-wrap the VSS project.

  15. Click Finish to open the project.

Note: Any VSS files with working folders in VSS that happen to match the working folders in StarTeam are displayed in the File list with the Unknown status. You must update the status of these files on your workstation.
